name: Earth Release: Mud Wall
summary: Create a sudden vertical barrier of hardened mud/earth to block attacks or slow advances.
technique: Gather earth-nature chakra into the soles of the feet.
Strike the ground to force a vertical surge of packed mud.
Harden the surface quickly with concentrated chakra flow.
training: Soil sensing: practice detecting underground moisture and pebble density.
Rapid hardening drills: form and harden small patches within 5 seconds.
Directional surge practice: push walls at varied angles for cover.
tips: Works best on damp or loose terrain; dry rock reduces effectiveness.
Combine with water users to form instant concrete for longer durability.

markdown.text: A vertical wall of earth and mud is forced up from the ground to create cover or block incoming attacks.

name: Earth Release: Great Moving Earth Core
summary: Form a powerful collapsing sink or core that displaces and crushes targets by manipulating large volumes of earth.
technique: Channel earth chakra into a broad area beneath the target.
Pull and compact soil to create a sudden sink or rising column.
Use surrounding rock as a fulcrum to magnify displacement force.
training: Large-volume manipulation practice: move boulders with small chakra increments.
Stability drills: prevent self-sinking while shifting earth beneath you.
Timing and prediction: coordinate with allies to trap moving targets.
tips: Most effective in open terrain with loose strata.
Can be used to unbalance or trap taijutsu opponents who rely on footing.
sourcePage: Earth Release: Great Moving Earth Core

markdown.text: Earth Release: Great Moving Earth Core
A technique that displaces large portions of the ground to create sinkholes, pillars or crushing cores to overwhelm enemies.

name: Earth Release: Earth Dragon Bullet
summary: Launches hardened, segmented earth constructs shaped like a dragon that pierce and ram through targets.
technique: Compress earth chakra into a long tapered column.
Carve and segment the column with rotating chakra to simulate scales.
Launch forward with a linear thrust and sustain cohesion until impact.
training: Column compression exercises to ensure structural integrity at range.
Segmented shaping practice to balance rigidity and flexibility.
Accuracy drills against moving targets at varying distances.
tips: Can be combined with wind to increase range or water to soften and then harden around targets.
Aim for anchoring points (ground or structures) to maximize destructive leverage.

markdown.text: A tapered, dragon-shaped earth projectile formed and fired to pierce through defenses and terrain.
